alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:37AM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...A mixture of sleet and snow is expected with total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. North winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 35 to 40 mph will result in blowing snow with at times reduced visibility. In addition, wind chill values late tonight into Thursday morning are expected to range from 20 to 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 AM today to 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
